programme.desc: Allen's Got Balls: After returning to LA, Ton and Allen butt heads with a familiar old foe. They also discover a driving range golf ball picker vehicle. (S3, ep 17)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Bowling Pin Payday: Allen and Ton go head-to-head with a trash-talking auction buyer. They find a 19th century rifle and a mechanical bowling pinsetter from the 1960s. (S3, ep 16)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The Jersey Score: Ton and Allen are made to feel unwelcome at a silent auction in New Jersey. They uncover a vintage vehicle and a skeet throwing machine from the 1960s. (S3, ep 15)

programme.title: Junk & Disorderly
programme.desc: Henry Cole,Allen Millyard and Guy Willison visit top collector Stuart Imber before preparing to sell their latest finds at the Fairford Steam. (S3, ep 5)

programme.title: Junk & Disorderly
programme.desc: Henry, Allen and Guy explore a bike specialist's sheds, take a £1200 gamble, and head to an auto jumble. (S3, ep 6)

programme.title: Alien Corridors
programme.desc: Alaska: A powerful earthquake in 2018 seemed to lead to an increase in UFO sightings in Alaska - but why? Do the extra terrestrials have something to protect here? (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: Alien Corridors
programme.desc: Sedona: With all the activity that's been recorded here, Sedona seemingly doubles as an intergalactic airport - but what is drawing UFOs to this spot? (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Ancient UFOs: From the lore and history of ancient Egypt to the myths of Native Americans, mankind's past is riddled with the evidence of UFOs. (S1, ep 5)

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Deathbed Confessions: Many believe that extraterrestrial secrets are not just limited to the military - so could deathbed confessions provide evidence of the existence of UFOs? (S1, ep 6)

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Real Mafia Underground Sicily: Presenter Don Wildman uncovers the underworld of Sicily, tracing the network of ancient subterranean waterways used by the Mafia. (S3, ep 1)

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Gladiator: Blood Sport Naples/Rome: Presenter Don Wildman explores the meandering underworld of Naples in Rome. Were these aging structures used by ancient gladiators? (S3, ep 2)

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Secret Sin City, Las Vegas: Presenter Don Wildman uncovers the underground secret surveillance nerve centres and the latest technology that beats the cheaters in Las Vegas. (S3, ep 3)

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Okinawa: Tunnels Of Hell: Host Don Wildman discovers what it was like to live through the Battle of Okinawa in 1945, exploring the beehive of combat tunnels used by soldiers. (S3, ep 4)

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: London: City Of Blood: From body snatchers and serial killers to cults and bloody rituals, Victorian Londoners lived by their own rules. Don Wildman explores. (S3, ep 5)

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Barbarians' Lair: From Templar torture chambers to the tunnels of medieval knights, host Don Wildman uncovers the secret underworlds of Europe after the fall of the Roman Empire. (S3, ep 6)

programme.title: Secret Societies: In The Shadows

programme.title: New: Forbidden History

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Jane books a four-berth private luxury river cruiser to travel along the Thames from Hampton Court to Henley-on-Thames to celebrate the 70th birthdays of her good friends Sue and Olwen.

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Jane and friends continue their celebration trip along the River Thames, where they set sail for a Michelin three-starred restaurant, before ending the cruise at Henley-on Thames.

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: Sailing with the masses on the MSC Divina is a novelty for Jane, but the ship's Caribbean calling points bring back fond memories.

programme.title: Gibraltar: Escape to the Sun
programme.desc: British territory Gibraltar welcomes five million tourists every year, including 3,500 wedding couples. And it's also famous for its Barbary macaques, and a rich marine reserve.

programme.title: Corfu: Jewel of the Med
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley narrates this exploration of Corfu - famed for its olive oil, natural beauty, and history - as we visit an olive oil bar, Achilleion Palace, and the ancient village Gastouri. (Ep1)

programme.title: Inside Longleat
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of world-famous Longleat, as Lord and Lady Bath grant unprecedented access to their stately home, safari park and the staff who keep it all going. (Ep1/3)

programme.title: Inside Longleat
programme.desc: Celebrations for the 75th anniversary of the estate opening to the public step up as staff prepare for Icons of the Sky, a festival featuring Tiger Moths, helicopters and a Spitfire.

programme.title: Ben Fogle's Lost Worlds

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead...
programme.desc: ...Reckoning: (2023) Tom Cruise returns as Ethan Hunt and jumps a motorbike off a mountain for real. There's some stuff about an all-powerful AI. But it's the thrills that we're here for!

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: (2013) Drama starring Tom Hardy. A construction manager's life dramatically begins to fall apart as he drives home from work. With the voices of Ruth Wilson, Olivia Colman and Andrew Scott.

programme.title: Falcon Lake
programme.desc: (2022) Adults only coming-of-age drama. Thirteen-year-old Bastien becomes besotted with 16-year-old Chloé while on holiday at a lake in Quebec, which is apparently haunted. In French/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Spies in Disguise
programme.desc: (2019) Animated spy comedy caper with the voice of Will Smith. The 'world's most awesome spy' gets framed and has to go undercover as a pigeon to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Dragonball Evolution
programme.desc: (2009) Martial arts adventure. Justin Chatwin stars as the leader of a mystical band of warriors who are out to save the world from the ancient demon Lord Piccolo. With James Marsters.

programme.title: Prince Valiant
programme.desc: (1954) Swashbuckling adventure. One of King Arthur's courtiers, the Viking Prince Valiant (Robert Wagner) uncovers the evil Sir Brack's (James Mason) plot to kill the king. Can he foil him?

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of...
programme.desc: ...Unfortunate Events: (2004) Gothic family comedy starring Jim Carrey as the evil, scheming Count Olaf, who'll do whatever it takes to deprive three young orphans of their inheritance.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: (1989) Comedy-thriller starring Tom Hanks. A cop investigates a murder to which there's just one witness: Hooch, a slobbering, beer-drinking French mastiff, who now needs 24/7 protection.

programme.title: Transporter 3
programme.desc: (2008) Violent action-thriller with Jason Statham. Terrorists hire a courier to drive a kidnapped woman across Europe, on a journey that gets ever more dangerous.

programme.title: Vengeance
programme.desc: (2022) BJ Novak's comedy thriller. A big-city journalist is called to rural Texas after the girlfriend he doesn't have dies. Was it murder? Is there a podcast in it? With Ashton Kutcher.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: (2017) Sci-fi horror. Is there life on Mars? Looks like Jake Gyllenhaal, Ryan Reynolds and Rebecca Ferguson have found some. Exciting, right? Well...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Oliver!
programme.desc: (1968) Carol Reed's evergreen musical based on Charles Dickens' Oliver Twist, with Mark Lester starring as the young orphan in Victorian London. With Ron Moody and Oliver Reed.

programme.title: The Kid Who Would Be King
programme.desc: (2019) Fantasy adventure. A 12-year-old from modern-day suburbia finds King Arthur's sword Excalibur and must save the country from a sinister sorceress. With Patrick Stewart.

programme.title: Bumblebee
programme.desc: (2018) High-octane sci-fi action adventure starring Hailee Steinfeld. When Charlie drives home a clapped-out VW Beetle, she gets more than she bargained for: a huge robotic alien.

programme.title: Men in Black: International...
programme.desc: ...Interview Special: Stars Chris Hemsworth and Tessa Thompson, director F Gary Gray and producers Walter Parkes and Laurie Macdonald talk about bringing the series back for a fourth part.

programme.title: Men in Black: International
programme.desc: (2019) Fourth instalment of the sci-fi comedy franchise with Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Liam Neeson. An alien-obsessed rookie joins London's Men in Black team.

programme.title: Nobody
programme.desc: (2021) Action thriller with Bob Odenkirk. He's just a dad who goes to work and takes out the trash. But really he's an ex-assassin about to unleash his true self... and take out the trash.

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: (2022) Meta-comedy horror 're-quel' with Courteney Cox. Killer Ghostface returns to shock the younger generation out of their love of 'elevated horror' with a bit of old-fashioned slashing.

programme.title: Donkey Punch
programme.desc: (2008) Thriller. A group of British teenagers are partying aboard a luxury yacht in the Med when a sexual encounter ends in manslaughter... and provokes a life-or-death fight for survival.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: (2012) Quirky animated family comedy with the voices of Adam Sandler and Selena Gomez. Count Dracula runs a secluded hotel as a haven for monsters, but his daughter wants to see the world.

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: (2007) Supernatural thriller. Alexander Ludwig stars as The Seeker, who has the task of finding six items hidden throughout time, which the scary forces of The Dark are also looking for.

programme.title: Annie
programme.desc: (2014) Jamie Foxx stars in this reboot of the 1982 musical. Orphan Annie is transported to post-2008 recession-hit New York, where she becomes the ward of a germaphobe running for mayor.

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: (1999) Teen comedy with Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger. A student is furious to discover her prom date was bribed by her sister to invite her. But confusion ensues when he falls for her.

programme.title: The Greatest Showman
programme.desc: (2017) Hugh Jackman, Zac Efron and Michelle Williams star in the Golden-Globe-winning, toe-tapping smash hit musical about the life and times of P.T. Barnum, the creator of the circus.
(2023) Sci-fi action adventure starring Adam Driver as a spaceman who crash-lands on a strange planet where giant lizards stalk the darkness... 65 million years ago. Where on Earth is he?

programme.title: Brassed Off
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy-drama with Pete Postlethwaite, Ewan McGregor and Tara Fitzgerald. When a Yorkshire mining pit closes down, its band tries to win a music contest to restore community pride.

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: Seven pairs remain as the drama moves to the Games Terrace, where the guests face a sharply personal Hotel Game that puts secrets and strategy to the test. The players then hit the gas in a high-energy Day Trip Challenge at a coastal drag strip. programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast

programme.title: For Your Eyes Only
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore, Carole Bouquet and Topol. When a secret surveillance device is lost at sea, James Bond is called in to recover the instrument before it falls into Russian hands.

programme.title: The British Airways Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. A three-day long police interview of Robert Brown finally ended with a confession and the pilot leading officers to the site where Joanna Simpson was buried, a remote spot in Windsor Great Park. The trial that followed saw Brown deny murder with a defence of adjustment disorder due to diminished responsibility and 13 years on, he has served half his prison sentence and is due to be released. Can a high-profile campaign from Joanna's family keep him behind bars?

programme.title: Ainsley's Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott makes recipes featuring grains and pulses, beginning with a summery dish of pan-seared sardines with a thyme-roasted vine tomato and bread salad, before preparing tikka kebabs with a chickpea salad

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Andrea, Val, Nabeel and Meng pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as four new stars - reality TV star Ekin-Su Cülcüloglu, actor and comedian Hugh Dennis, author and interiors expert Kelly Hoppen, and former footballer Shaun Wright-Phillips - and their mentors, cook for their loved ones. programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by Italian chef Gennaro Contaldo, who is served a full English breakfast loaf and gives the hosts a lesson in whittling. programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Charley Boorman from Long Way Home while also enjoying a feast of delicious recipes from chefs Asma Khan, Ronnie Murray, and Mike Reid.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Wrexham v West Bromwich Albion (Kick-off 12.30pm). Katie Shanahan presents all the action from the Championship match at StoK Racecourse. Wrexham are playing their first season in the second tier since the 1981/82 campaign, while the Baggies have not been outside the top two divisions since 1991/92. However, Wrexham have continued to invest in their squad under the ownership of Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney and will be expecting to hold their own at this level. With commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern takes the show across the pond for a special long episode from Walt Disney World Resort in Florida with classic games and brand-new ones too.

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The celebrity team come to the end of their fast-track training to dive with 18-foot tiger sharks and relocate to the world-famous dive site of Tiger Beach - after getting one last chance to hone their skills and demonstrate that they are ready to take part, the qualified team members come face to face with the iconic shark. Will the celebrities have their perceptions changed in a life-changing encounter, are they still monsters to be scared of, or is their biggest fear an ocean without sharks?

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure inspired by the book by JK Rowling, starring Eddie Redmayne, Katherine Waterston and Colin Farrell. Magizoologist Newt Scamander and his friends must capture an escaped magical menagerie before Manhattan wizardry is outlawed.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand and TV presenter Dan Walker take up the challenge, hoping to win as much as £1million for their chosen charities. As ever, lifelines including Phone a Friend, Ask the Host and 50-50 are available to them if they get stuck. Hosted by Jeremy Clarkson

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: Would-be writer Simone has finally written the one story she could never get out of her mind and her debut book One Night is about to be published. However it soon becomes clear that the devastating story told does not exclusively belong to her. Australian drama, starring Nicole da Silva, Jodie Whittaker and Yael Stone

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show: Special Guests
programme.desc: A look back at more of the most memorable moments from recent series, including interviews with Jack Black, Stormzy, Grace Jones, Steve Coogan, Emma Stone, Andy Serkis, Emma Thompson, Nile Rodgers and Brian Cox

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Preston North End v Leicester City at Deepdale, Blackburn Rovers v Birmingham City at Ewood Park and Swansea City v Sheffield United at Swansea.com Stadium in the Championship

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: Kate Lawson's provocative artwork takes centre stage in the courtroom. Bloom focuses on its preoccupation with mortality and suggests Kate orchestrated Claire's death for her final work. A complicated mental health diagnosis is revealed, which is particularly pertinent for Vanessa

programme.title: Ainsley's Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott prepares dishes involving dairy products, including a Greek lamb burger topped with feta and mint, and a sweet pizza topped with apricots and blueberries, served with a delicious amaretto cream. Joseph Denison Carey gets a lesson in cheese-making

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Charley Boorman from Long Way Home while also enjoying a feast of delicious recipes from chefs Asma Khan, Ronnie Murray, and Mike Reid.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by actress Hayley Tamaddon for a space hopper race, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity advocate, and Aldo Zilli serves up delicious drinks

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan this time are actress and West End star Janie Dee, Betty Spencer herself - actress Michele Dotrice - and Tom Surgey with some summer spritzers.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates recipes for Mexican food, beginning with carne asada tacos with chargrilled spring onions and a chiltomate salsa. Ruby Bhogal provides a masterclass in chillies, tries a birria taco, and knocks up an elote-topped salad, while Jayne Middlemiss serves up cheesy bean and corn quesadillas with guacamole, before Ainsley completes the show with a hearty stew of pork pozole

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara host the grand final of the obstacle course challenge, with the final five competitors from across the nation testing their strength, speed and courage. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Catchphrase: Catchiest Moments
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern presents a compilation of some of his favourite moments from the quiz show, from the funniest answers to the strangest. Featuring previously unseen footage, and giving viewers a chance to play along at home as contestants make unexpected attempts to Say What They See

programme.title: Octopussy
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore, Maud Adams and Louis Jourdan. A British agent killed in East Germany is found dressed as a clown, clutching a priceless Fabergé egg. James Bond sets out to solve the mystery and finds himself pitted against Octopussy, a rich businesswoman with her own private army and an interest in priceless antiques.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Martin from Leeds, Dylan from Aberdare, Sonia from Merseyside and Karen from Exmouth pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as Natalie Cassidy, Jack Osbourne, Jordan North, Shaun Wright-Phillips, Hugh Dennis and Kelly Hoppen take on one another in the show's first-ever six-way cooking battle. The contestants have to deliver a British classic using only air fryers in just 30 minutes, with the bottom two having to cook more speedy dishes in a bid to secure a place in the quarter-final

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: The discovery of a decomposed body in the depths of Hawsley Wood sends shockwaves through the investigative team as it is identified as a woman who vanished six years previously. Ridley joins forces with Carol and Goodwin to delve into the circumstances surrounding the case and is forced to enlist the help of a disgraced ex-copper who oversaw the original investigation

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi action adventure starring James Franco and Freida Pinto. When scientist Will Rodman's programme of drug experiments to find a cure for Alzheimer's disease is shut down he secretly takes an offspring from one of the chimpanzees he was using into his home and names him Caesar. Caesar has inherited the effects of the trial drug and begins to show remarkable intelligence, a development that will put him on a violent collision course with the humans who have abused him.

programme.title: Creed III
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Jonathan Majors. Retired from life in the ring and based in LA, Adonis Creed is focusing on his family and the gym he owns. But his past comes back to haunt him when his childhood friend Damian Anderson, a former boxing prodigy, emerges from a stretch in prison. Damian plans to resume his once promising career - and he wants Adonis to help him train for his return.

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: Seven pairs remain as the drama moves to the Games Terrace, where the guests face a sharply personal Hotel Game that puts secrets and strategy to the test. The players then hit the gas in a high-energy Day Trip Challenge at a coastal drag strip. Racing in colourful jeeps, each pair must complete a visual puzzle before scouring a sea of flags to find their place in the pecking order for a chance to shake up the game. Stephen Mangan hosts

When scientist Will Rodman's programme of drug experiments to find a cure for Alzheimer's disease is shut down he secretly takes an offspring from one of the chimpanzees he was using into his home and names him Caesar. Caesar has inherited the effects of the trial drug and begins to show remarkable intelligence, a development that will put him on a violent collision course with the humans who have abused him.

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: Seven pairs remain as the drama moves to the Games Terrace, where the guests face a sharply personal Hotel Game that puts secrets and strategy to the test. The players then hit the gas in a high-energy Day Trip Challenge at a coastal drag strip. Racing in colourful jeeps, each pair must complete a visual puzzle before scouring a sea of flags to find their place in the pecking order for a chance to shake up the game. Stephen Mangan hosts

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Comedian Eddie Kadi joins the pair as Shivi serves up croissant cups for breakfast. The tortoises at the wildlife park have a bath, Shivi heads to the beach to learn about the magnificent crab of the Suffolk coast, and local baker David teaches Jimmy, Shivi and Eddie how to make a crab out of bread

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Fern meets Arthur, a 12-year-old rescue cat with diabetes whose owner, Kerina, is using the latest technology to monitor her pet's blood sugar levels. Vet Amy performs surgery to remove a lump from King Charles Spaniel Eddie. James neuters a dog who has been rescued from Macedonia, and Fern also helps out when young Cavapoo Mila gets preventative treatment

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Housemates Malachy and Dan from London, sporty sisters Tramika and Niasha from Birmingham, and mother and daughter Liela and Sarah from Croydon work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leave with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh is cheering on Rhys from Port Talbot, Ann from Hertfordshire, Bethan from Bristol and Darren from Leeds all the way as they try to beat one of the country's finest quiz brains and take home thousands of pounds

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Robert loses his temper, April is left with a decision, and Jacob is sad.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Abi and Carl conspire to cover their tracks, Carla prepares to propose to Lisa in the Rovers, and Steve panics, thinking that Dorin has popped out

programme.title: Under the Bridge
programme.desc: Past and present wounds entwine as Rebecca and Cam's alliance is tested. The Virks discuss taking matters into their own hands, and the teens use a school dance as cover for their escape plan as another life is threatened

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: For Your Eyes Only
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore, Carole Bouquet and Topol. When a secret surveillance device is lost at sea, James Bond is called in to recover the instrument before it falls into Russian hands.

programme.title: The British Airways Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. A three-day long police interview of Robert Brown finally ended with a confession and the pilot leading officers to the site where Joanna Simpson was buried, a remote spot in Windsor Great Park. The trial that followed saw Brown deny murder with a defence of adjustment disorder due to diminished responsibility and 13 years on, he has served half his prison sentence and is due to be released. Can a high-profile campaign from Joanna's family keep him behind bars?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Rachel Parris to try pond dipping, Michael and Gen transform a charity advocate, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks.

programme.title: Ainsley's Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott makes recipes featuring grains and pulses, beginning with a summery dish of pan-seared sardines with a thyme-roasted vine tomato and bread salad, before preparing tikka kebabs with a chickpea salad

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Andrea, Val, Nabeel and Meng pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as four new stars - reality TV star Ekin-Su Cülcüloglu, actor and comedian Hugh Dennis, author and interiors expert Kelly Hoppen, and former footballer Shaun Wright-Phillips - and their mentors, cook for their loved ones. They'll have to produce delicious dishes with the added pressure of not only impressing the chefs, but their friends and family who will also be in the studio including Hugh's friend David Baddiel

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by Italian chef Gennaro Contaldo, who is served a full English breakfast loaf and gives the hosts a lesson in whittling. Vet Henry checks up on some new arrivals at the wildlife park in the form of of baby maras and Max makes copper coat hooks in the workshop

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Charley Boorman from Long Way Home while also enjoying a feast of delicious recipes from chefs Asma Khan, Ronnie Murray, and Mike Reid.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Wrexham v West Bromwich Albion (Kick-off 12.30pm). Katie Shanahan presents all the action from the Championship match at StoK Racecourse. Wrexham are playing their first season in the second tier since the 1981/82 campaign, while the Baggies have not been outside the top two divisions since 1991/92. However, Wrexham have continued to invest in their squad under the ownership of Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney and will be expecting to hold their own at this level. With commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern takes the show across the pond for a special long episode from Walt Disney World Resort in Florida with classic games and brand-new ones too.

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The celebrity team come to the end of their fast-track training to dive with 18-foot tiger sharks and relocate to the world-famous dive site of Tiger Beach - after getting one last chance to hone their skills and demonstrate that they are ready to take part, the qualified team members come face to face with the iconic shark. Will the celebrities have their perceptions changed in a life-changing encounter, are they still monsters to be scared of, or is their biggest fear an ocean without sharks?

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure inspired by the book by JK Rowling, starring Eddie Redmayne, Katherine Waterston and Colin Farrell. Magizoologist Newt Scamander and his friends must capture an escaped magical menagerie before Manhattan wizardry is outlawed.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand and TV presenter Dan Walker take up the challenge, hoping to win as much as £1million for their chosen charities. As ever, lifelines including Phone a Friend, Ask the Host and 50-50 are available to them if they get stuck. Hosted by Jeremy Clarkson

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: Would-be writer Simone has finally written the one story she could never get out of her mind and her debut book One Night is about to be published. However it soon becomes clear that the devastating story told does not exclusively belong to her. Australian drama, starring Nicole da Silva, Jodie Whittaker and Yael Stone

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show: Special Guests
programme.desc: A look back at more of the most memorable moments from recent series, including interviews with Jack Black, Stormzy, Grace Jones, Steve Coogan, Emma Stone, Andy Serkis, Emma Thompson, Nile Rodgers and Brian Cox

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Preston North End v Leicester City at Deepdale, Blackburn Rovers v Birmingham City at Ewood Park and Swansea City v Sheffield United at Swansea.com Stadium in the Championship

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: Kate Lawson's provocative artwork takes centre stage in the courtroom. Bloom focuses on its preoccupation with mortality and suggests Kate orchestrated Claire's death for her final work. A complicated mental health diagnosis is revealed, which is particularly pertinent for Vanessa

programme.desc: The celebrity team come to the end of their fast-track training to dive with 18-foot tiger sharks and relocate to the world-famous dive site of Tiger Beach - after getting one last chance to hone their skills and demonstrate that they are ready to take part, the qualified team members come face to face with the iconic shark. Will the celebrities have their perceptions changed in a life-changing encounter, are they still monsters to be scared of, or is their biggest fear an ocean without sharks?

programme.title: Ainsley's Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott prepares dishes involving dairy products, including a Greek lamb burger topped with feta and mint, and a sweet pizza topped with apricots and blueberries, served with a delicious amaretto cream. Joseph Denison Carey gets a lesson in cheese-making

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Charley Boorman from Long Way Home while also enjoying a feast of delicious recipes from chefs Asma Khan, Ronnie Murray, and Mike Reid.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by actress Hayley Tamaddon for a space hopper race, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity advocate, and Aldo Zilli serves up delicious drinks

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan this time are actress and West End star Janie Dee, Betty Spencer herself - actress Michele Dotrice - and Tom Surgey with some summer spritzers.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates recipes for Mexican food, beginning with carne asada tacos with chargrilled spring onions and a chiltomate salsa. Ruby Bhogal provides a masterclass in chillies, tries a birria taco, and knocks up an elote-topped salad, while Jayne Middlemiss serves up cheesy bean and corn quesadillas with guacamole, before Ainsley completes the show with a hearty stew of pork pozole

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara host the grand final of the obstacle course challenge, with the final five competitors from across the nation testing their strength, speed and courage. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Catchphrase: Catchiest Moments
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern presents a compilation of some of his favourite moments from the quiz show, from the funniest answers to the strangest. Featuring previously unseen footage, and giving viewers a chance to play along at home as contestants make unexpected attempts to Say What They See

programme.title: Octopussy
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore, Maud Adams and Louis Jourdan. A British agent killed in East Germany is found dressed as a clown, clutching a priceless Fabergé egg. James Bond sets out to solve the mystery and finds himself pitted against Octopussy, a rich businesswoman with her own private army and an interest in priceless antiques.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Martin from Leeds, Dylan from Aberdare, Sonia from Merseyside and Karen from Exmouth pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as Natalie Cassidy, Jack Osbourne, Jordan North, Shaun Wright-Phillips, Hugh Dennis and Kelly Hoppen take on one another in the show's first-ever six-way cooking battle. The contestants have to deliver a British classic using only air fryers in just 30 minutes, with the bottom two having to cook more speedy dishes in a bid to secure a place in the quarter-final

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: The discovery of a decomposed body in the depths of Hawsley Wood sends shockwaves through the investigative team as it is identified as a woman who vanished six years previously. Ridley joins forces with Carol and Goodwin to delve into the circumstances surrounding the case and is forced to enlist the help of a disgraced ex-copper who oversaw the original investigation

programme.title: Creed III
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Jonathan Majors. Retired from life in the ring and based in LA, Adonis Creed is focusing on his family and the gym he owns. But his past comes back to haunt him when his childhood friend Damian Anderson, a former boxing prodigy, emerges from a stretch in prison. Damian plans to resume his once promising career - and he wants Adonis to help him train for his return.

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as Natalie Cassidy, Jack Osbourne, Jordan North, Shaun Wright-Phillips, Hugh Dennis and Kelly Hoppen take on one another in the show's first-ever six-way cooking battle. The contestants have to deliver a British classic using only air fryers in just 30 minutes, with the bottom two having to cook more speedy dishes in a bid to secure a place in the quarter-final

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: The discovery of a decomposed body in the depths of Hawsley Wood sends shockwaves through the investigative team as it is identified as a woman who vanished six years previously. Ridley joins forces with Carol and Goodwin to delve into the circumstances surrounding the case and is forced to enlist the help of a disgraced ex-copper who oversaw the original investigation

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi action adventure starring James Franco and Freida Pinto. When scientist Will Rodman's programme of drug experiments to find a cure for Alzheimer's disease is shut down he secretly takes an offspring from one of the chimpanzees he was using into his home and names him Caesar. Caesar has inherited the effects of the trial drug and begins to show remarkable intelligence, a development that will put him on a violent collision course with the humans who have abused him.
